action->Avernal Fever.name: Avernal Fever
action->Avernal Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

action->Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
action->Infernal Wound.description:
A bearded devil's glaive Strike also deals [[/r 1d6[persistent,bleed]]] damage that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

action->Reposition.name: Reposition
action->Reposition.description:
Trigger The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Wriggling Beard
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

action->Disgusting Demise.name: Disgusting Demise
action->Disgusting Demise.description: When the grothlut is reduced to 0 Hit Points, its digestive organs rupture, unleashing alchemical acid and poison upon all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take [[/r 2d6[acid]]] damage and become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (double damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Piteous Moan.name: Piteous Moan
action->Piteous Moan.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Each non-grothlut creature that enters or starts its turn within the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:17] saving throw or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The creature then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

The grothlut can activate or deactivate the aura by using a single free action that has the concentrate trait. A grothlut usually does not begin moaning until it senses the presence of a non-grothlut creature, and it usually stops once it doesn't sense any more such creatures.

action->Counterfeit Haunting.name: Counterfeit Haunting
action->Counterfeit Haunting.description:
Trigger A living creature moves over the rune

Effect A frightful moan echoes through the room, and a hoarse telepathic voice shouts, "Get out!"

This shout deals [[/r 6d12[mental]]] damage to creatures in the room (@Check[type:will|dc:26|basic:true] save). Creatures who fail this saving throw must immediately leave the room and can't willingly reenter it for 1 minute (1 hour on a critical failure).

action->Glow.name: Glow
action->Glow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Glitterdust}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}.

action->Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect The will-o'wisp feeds on the creature's terror. It regains [[/r 2d4[healing]]]{2d4 Hit Points}, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.

action->Defensive Needle.name: Defensive Needle
action->Defensive Needle.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee Strike against the dreshkan

Effect The dreshkan makes a needle Strike against that creature.

action->Partially Technological.name: Partially Technological
action->Partially Technological.description: A dreshkan is partially technological. Positive healing effects only heal a dreshkan half as much as normal.

action->Needle Spray.name: Needle Spray
action->Needle Spray.description:
The dreshkan braces itself on all four limbs and sprays needles at as many creatures as it would like in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing [[/r {2d4[piercing],2d8[electricity]}]]{2d4 piercing damage plus 2d8 electricity damage}. Each targeted creature in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

Note: Paizo did not provide a listed DC for this ability. The suggested DC to use per the GMG is @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]

action->Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
action->Swarming Stance.description: A dreshkan can share the same space as a morlock or another dreshkan, but no more than two such creatures can occupy the same space. When these creatures share the same space, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls.

The dreshkan braces itself on all four limbs and sprays needles at as many creatures as it would like in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing [[/r {2d4[piercing],2d8[electricity]}]]{2d4 piercing damage plus 2d8 electricity damage}. Each targeted creature in the area must attempt a basic Reflex save.

Note: Paizo did not provide a listed DC for this ability. The suggested DC to use per the GMG is @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|basic:true]

action->Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
action->Swarming Stance.description: A dreshkan can share the same space as a morlock or another dreshkan, but no more than two such creatures can occupy the same space. When these creatures share the same space, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls.

action->Defensive Needle.name: Defensive Needle
action->Defensive Needle.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a melee Strike against the dreshkan

Effect The dreshkan makes a needle Strike against that creature.

action->Partially Technological.name: Partially Technological
action->Partially Technological.description: A dreshkan is partially technological. Positive healing effects only heal a dreshkan half as much as normal.

action->War Leader.name: War Leader
action->War Leader.description:
A mulventok's fervor inspires its allies. Allies within 30 feet that can see or hear the mulventok gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and skill checks as long as their actions don't impede the mulventok's imprinted purpose.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.64wrP9IbfHbj1mrA]{Effect: War Leader}

action->Explosive Decay.name: Explosive Decay
action->Explosive Decay.description: When a mulventok dies, its mirrored flesh ruptures and explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]{20-foot radius}. Creatures caught in the blast are covered with viscera and take [[/r 8d6[negative]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true] save).

action->Stay in the Fight.name: Stay in the Fight
action->Stay in the Fight.description:
Trigger An allied creature within 30 feet reaches 0 HP

Effect The mulventok imparts some of its own energy to keep the ally fighting. The target creature gains 1 Hit Point, and the mulventok takes [[/r 2d6[mental]]] damage.

action->Fervent Command.name: Fervent Command
action->Fervent Command.description: The mulventok shouts an order to one of its allies within 30 feet. That ally immediately takes a @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or Step action. A creature can benefit from only once per round.

action->Psychokinetic Honing.name: Psychokinetic Honing
action->Psychokinetic Honing.description: A thrown weapon gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning} rune when a mulventok throws it. Thrown weapons the mulventok uses deal an additional [[/r 1d6[mental]]] damage, whether used in melee or thrown.

action->Pus Burst.name: Pus Burst
action->Pus Burst.description:
Trigger The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage

Effect A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals [[/r 4d6[negative]]] damage. The affected creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

action->Mark Quarry.name: Mark Quarry
action->Mark Quarry.description: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks when it @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seeks} its quarry, to Survival checks when it @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracks} its quarry, and damage rolls when it Strikes its quarry.

action->Tentacle Transfer.name: Tentacle Transfer
action->Tentacle Transfer.description:
Requirement The chuul has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The chuul transfers the grabbed creature from its claws to its tentacles, or vice versa. A creature is exposed to the chuul's paralytic venom when transferred into the tentacles and at the start of each of the chuul's turns if it remains grabbed by the tentacles.

weapon->Composite Longbow.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dUC8Fsa6FZtVikS3]

This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Glaive.description:

This polearm consists of a long, single‑edged blade on the end of a 7‑foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

action->Web Trap.description: A creature hit by a drider's web attack is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface (Escape DC 21).

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}

action->Feed.name: Feed
action->Feed.description:
Requirement The ghonhatine is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghonhatine devours a chunk of the corpse. For 1 minute, the ghonhatine gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing 5} and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. It can gain these benefits from any given corpse only once.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wPW6kVscJgBLPVKZ]{Effect: Ghonhatine Feed}

action->Fleshgout.name: Fleshgout
action->Fleshgout.description:
A ghonhatine's vomit carries an awful disease that, over time, can cause a suffering creature's flesh to develop painful boils that eventually slough away, leaving gaping wounds

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/r 1d4 #Incubation]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 enfeebled 2 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} (1 day)

Stage 5 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}, enfeebled 2, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 6 dead

action->Gibbering.name: Gibbering
action->Gibbering.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Each creature that begins its turn within 60 feet of a gibbering mouther must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:19] save. On a failure, they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round. On a success, they are temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Reactive Gnaw.name: Reactive Gnaw
action->Reactive Gnaw.description:
Trigger An adjacent creature deals the gibbering mouther slashing damage.

Effect The gibbering mouther's wound opens into another maw. It makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Burn Eyes.name: Burn Eyes
action->Burn Eyes.description: A creature that takes damage from a gibbering mouther's spittle must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round on a critical failure).

action->Engulf.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]

@Check[type:reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect], [[/r 3d8[piercing]]], Escape DC 22, Rupture 8

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

action->Ground Manipulation.name: Ground Manipulation
action->Ground Manipulation.description: The gibbering mouther causes stone and earth under its body to grow soft and muddy, remaining so for 1 minute after the mouther moves off the location. A gibbering mouther can move through these areas with ease, but other creatures treat them as difficult terrain.

action->Powerful Stench.name: Powerful Stench
action->Powerful Stench.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}; on a critical failure, the creature is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it is sickened.

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

action->Bouncing Crush.name: Bouncing Crush
action->Bouncing Crush.description:
The gibtanius Leaps and can end this Leap occupying the same space as other creatures.

It deals [[/r 5d6[bludgeoning]]] damage to each creature in the space it Leaps to (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save), then @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoves} each of those creatures. If it fails to Shove any creature out of its space, it bounces to the closest available space of its choosing that does not contain any creatures.

Bouncing Crush counts as one attack when determining the gibtanius's multiple attack penalty.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The gibtanius vomits a stream of acid that deals [[/r 9d6[acid]]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true] save).

It can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Eerie Flexibility.name: Eerie Flexibility
action->Eerie Flexibility.description: Despite its size, the gug's multiple joints allow it to fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed.

action->Furious Claws.name: Furious Claws
action->Furious Claws.description: The gug makes up to four claw Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks all count toward the gug's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the gug makes all its attacks.

action->Skittering Reposition.name: Skittering Reposition
action->Skittering Reposition.description:
Trigger A creature that starts its move outside the gogiteth's reach moves into its reach.

Effect The gogiteth moves 10 feet. This does not trigger reactions.

action->Carry Off Prey.name: Carry Off Prey
action->Carry Off Prey.description: The gogiteth can move at its full Speed while it has a creature @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in its jaws, bringing the grabbed creature along.

action->Skittering Assault.name: Skittering Assault
action->Skittering Assault.description: The gogiteth Strides three times. Once per Stride, it can attempt a leg Strike against a creature in its reach at any point during the Stride; it must make each attack against a different creature, but it doesn't apply its multiple attack penalty until after making all its Strikes. If any of the Strikes result in a critical failure, Skittering Assault ends.

When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

action->Coven.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.52CdldlWMiVTZk1F]

The witchfire adds @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.tlcrVRqW1MSKJ5IC]{Phantasmal Killer}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.0XP2XOxT9VSiXFDr]{Phantasmal Calamity}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.i1TvBID5QLyXrUCa]{Summon Entity} to their coven's spells.

A coven can contain one or more witchfires, but it must also include at least one living creature capable of forming a coven; three witchfires cannot form a coven.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

action->Opportune Witchflame.name: Opportune Witchflame
action->Opportune Witchflame.description:
Trigger A creature makes a melee Strike against or touches the witchfire

Effect The witchfire makes a witchflame caress Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When the witchfire warden is destroyed, and as long as any creatures remain in stasis in this room, she reforms in [[/br 1d4 #Rejuvenation]]{1d4 days} at the soot-blackened pillar, fully healed.

action->Witchflame.name: Witchflame
action->Witchflame.description:
Any creature that takes negative damage from a witchfire's Strike must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to witchflame for 1 hour.

Success The creature appears to catch fire with sickly green flames. These flames deal no damage on their own, but as long as the flames burn, the creature can't be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} rather than being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}) and gains weakness 5 to fire for 1 round.

Failure As success, but the effect is permanent until removed.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature gains weakness 10 to fire.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.NHwmrSyF0e8HUE3m]{Effect: Witchflame (Success)}

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.L7SiTshdimUPWfnB]{Effect: Witchflame (Failure)}

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.McawF8weCe7O81um]{Effect: Witchflame (Critical Failure)}

action->Witchflame Kindling.name: Witchflame Kindling
action->Witchflame Kindling.description:
Requirements A creature within 30 feet of the witchfire burns with witchflame

Effect The witchfire's eyes and mouth glow brightly, and the witchflame on the target creature momentarily burns much hotter, dealing [[/r {5d6[fire],5d6[negative]}]]{5d6 fire damage and 5d6 negative damage} to that creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The witchfire can't use Witchflame Kindling for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Witchflame Kindling]]{1d4 rounds}.

weapon->Composite Longbow.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dUC8Fsa6FZtVikS3]

This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

weapon->Longsword.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Longswords can be one‑edged or two‑edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

armor->Breastplate.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.r0ifJfoz8aqf0mwk]

Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

action->Flames of Fury.name: Flames of Fury
action->Flames of Fury.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

action->Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade
action->Furious Fusillade.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

action->Rope Snare.name: Rope Snare
action->Rope Snare.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

weapon->Hellforged Glaive.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vlnzTSsRmWeSkt9O]

This polearm consists of a long, single‑edged blade on the end of a 7‑foot pole. It is extremely effective at delivering lethal cuts at a distance.

In the hands of a devil, the sinister powers of this weapon grant it the Agile trait and increase the size of the deadly damage dice by one step, to Deadly d10.

Although worth as much as an ordinary weapon of its kind, hellforged weapons exude palpable menace, so upstanding merchants usually refuse to trade in them.

action->Avernal Fever.name: Avernal Fever
action->Avernal Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

action->Infernal Wound.name: Infernal Wound
action->Infernal Wound.description:
A bearded devil's glaive Strike also deals [[/r 1d6[persistent,bleed]]] damage that resists attempts to heal it.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

action->Reposition.name: Reposition
action->Reposition.description:
Trigger The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Wriggling Beard
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

The flat check to stop the bleeding starts at @Check[type:flat|dc:20]. The DC is reduced to @Check[type:flat|dc:15] only if the bleeding creature or an ally successfully assists with the recovery. The DC to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to a creature with an infernal wound is increased by 5.

A spellcaster or item attempting to use healing magic on a creature suffering from an infernal wound must succeed at a DC 21 counteract check or the magic fails to heal the creature.

action->Reposition.name: Reposition
action->Reposition.description:
Trigger The devil hits a creature with a glaive Strike.

Effect The devil moves the creature 5 feet in any direction. The destination square must be within reach of the devil's glaive.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Wriggling Beard.name: Wriggling Beard
action->Wriggling Beard.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect The barbazu makes a beard Strike. This Strike ignores their multiple attack penalty and doesn't count toward that penalty.

action->Flames of Fury.name: Flames of Fury
action->Flames of Fury.description: Any weapon an erinys holds gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.

action->Furious Fusillade.name: Furious Fusillade
action->Furious Fusillade.description: The erinys hovers in place if they are flying and fires one arrow at any number of creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Each attack is rolled separately. This counts as one attack for the purpose of the erinys's multiple attack penalty.

action->Rope Snare.name: Rope Snare
action->Rope Snare.description:
An erinys carries a coil of rope woven of their hair (use the statistics for @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.fyYnQf1NAx9fWFaS]{Rope}) that animates in their hands.

When a creature is hit by the erinys's rope, a segment of the rope tears loose and wraps itself around the creature, imposing a 10-foot circumstance penalty to Speed. The piece that tears off is 10 feet long for a Medium or smaller creature, and doubles in length for each size larger than Medium.

When a creature @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} the effect (DC 26), the detached segment of rope withers away into useless black sludge.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.o0zqsH5kYopRanav]{Effect: Rope Snare}

action->Disgusting Demise.name: Disgusting Demise
action->Disgusting Demise.description: When the grothlut is reduced to 0 Hit Points, its digestive organs rupture, unleashing alchemical acid and poison upon all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save or take [[/r 2d6[acid]]] damage and become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (double damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Piteous Moan.name: Piteous Moan
action->Piteous Moan.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Each non-grothlut creature that enters or starts its turn within the area must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:17] saving throw or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). The creature then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

The grothlut can activate or deactivate the aura by using a single free action that has the concentrate trait. A grothlut usually does not begin moaning until it senses the presence of a non-grothlut creature, and it usually stops once it doesn't sense any more such creatures.

action->Draining Glance.name: Draining Glance
action->Draining Glance.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet that the bodak can perceive with its @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} starts its turn

Effect The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save. If it fails, the bodak regains 5 Hit Points and the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

action->Sunlight Vulnerability.name: Sunlight Vulnerability
action->Sunlight Vulnerability.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, the bodak can't use actions with the death trait and it becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the bodak ends its turn in sunlight. If the bodak loses all its actions this way, it is destroyed.

action->Bodak Spawn.name: Bodak Spawn
action->Bodak Spawn.description: Any humanoid who dies while @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} by a bodak rises as an autonomous bodak 24 hours after its death.

action->Death Gaze.name: Death Gaze
action->Death Gaze.description:
The bodak stares at a living creature within 30 feet that it can sense with its @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense}. That creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. If the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, the bodak gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 5 times the value of the drained condition the target gained.

Multiple exposures to this ability can increase a creature's drained condition to a maximum of 4. If the bodak is destroyed, any @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed} condition a creature has gained from Death Gaze are removed.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}.

action->Dread Flickering.name: Dread Flickering
action->Dread Flickering.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A dread wisp, though naturally invisible, glows with a grayish illumination, casting dim light in the aura and making them visible. Living creatures that end their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:25] saving throw or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

Those that critically succeed are temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A dread wisp is immune to all spells except @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.DyiD239dNS7RIxZE]{Searing Light}, and spells with the positive trait.

action->Feed on Despair.name: Feed on Despair
action->Feed on Despair.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement An enemy within 15 feet of the dread wisp is under a fear effect, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained}, or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}

Effect The dread wisp feeds on the creature's despair. The dread wisp regains [[/r 2d8[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points} and deals [[/r 3d8[negative]]] damage to the creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save), and if the dread wisp has Gone Dark, their Dread Flickering reignites.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The dread wisp extinguishes their Dread Flickering, becoming invisible. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If the dread wisp uses their draining touch Strike while invisible, the arc of pale energy lets any observer determine their location, making them hidden to all observers only until the dread wisp moves.

action->Shadow Flitter.name: Shadow Flitter
action->Shadow Flitter.description: The dread wisp teleports to a square they can see within 30 feet that isn't in an area of bright light. The dread wisp can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Wearying Touch.name: Wearying Touch
action->Wearying Touch.description: If the dread wisp critically hits with their draining touch Strike, the target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

action->Negative Healing.name:

armor->Leather Armor.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4tIVTg9wj56RrveA]

A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Black Smear Poison.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.cTBmQgWUyf50x3dY]

Many calignis use a debilitating poison crafted from subterranean fungi.

Activate T Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 As stage 1

Stage 3 [[/r 1d6[poison]]] damage, and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

action->Death Flame.name: Death Flame
action->Death Flame.description:
When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] take [[/r 5d6[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save).

The stalker's gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

action->Double Slice.name: Double Slice
action->Double Slice.description: The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

action->Encircling Command.name: Encircling Command
action->Encircling Command.description: Each caligni creeper within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the stalker can Step. Each creeper can benefit from Encircling Command only once per round.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The caligni stalker deals [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 extra precision damage} to flat‑footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

action->Death Flame.name: Death Flame
action->Death Flame.description:
When the stalker dies, their body combusts in a flash of white-hot flame. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] take [[/r 5d6[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true] save).

The stalker's gear and treasure are unaffected by the flames and are left in a pile where they died.

action->Double Slice.name: Double Slice
action->Double Slice.description: The caligni stalker makes two Strikes against the same target, one with each of their shortswords. The stalker combines the damage of any attacks that hit and applies precision damage, resistances, and weaknesses only once. Both attacks count toward the stalker's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty increases only after both attacks.

weapon->Composite Longbow.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.dUC8Fsa6FZtVikS3]

This projectile weapon is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Like all longbows, its great size also increases the bow's range and power. You must use two hands to fire it, and it cannot be used while mounted. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a longbow, such as Erastil's favored weapon, it also applies to composite longbows unless otherwise stated.

The rhoka sword is the preferred weapon of urdefhan soldiers, though all urdefhans know how to wield these instruments of war.

consumable->Arrows.description:

These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
action->Necrotic Decay.description:
When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals [[/r 3d6[negative]]] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|basic:true] save).

action->Ravenous Attack.name: Ravenous Attack
action->Ravenous Attack.description: The urdefhan makes one rhoka sword Strike and one jaws Strike against a single creature. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

action->Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
action->Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on its last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains 5 HP (or, on a critical failure, it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains 10 HP).
  • Drain Vitality The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

action->Curse of Darkness.name: Curse of Darkness
action->Curse of Darkness.description:
The owb inflicts a curse on one creature taking persistent cold damage from their burning cold Strike, stealing the victim's vibrancy. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save.

On a failure, the creature gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]{Light Blindness} and its coloration turns to washed out shades of gray, along with all equipment it carries, wields, or wears. These effects have an unlimited duration. Regardless of the result of its save, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

If the owb uses this ability on a caligni, the curse can't be removed short of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} or similar powerful magic.

action->Glow.name: Glow
action->Glow.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A will-o'-wisp is itself naturally invisible, but glows with a colored light, casting bright light in the aura and making it visible.

action->Magic Immunity.name: Magic Immunity
action->Magic Immunity.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Glitterdust}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Magic Missile}, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Maze}.

action->Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
action->Feed on Fear.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp.

Effect The will-o'wisp feeds on the creature's terror. It regains [[/r 2d4[healing]]]{2d4 Hit Points}, and if it has Gone Dark, its glow reignites.

A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

action->Go Dark.name: Go Dark
action->Go Dark.description: The will-o'-wisp extinguishes its glow, becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}. It can end this effect with another use of this action. If it uses its shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine its location, making the will-o'-wisp only @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to all observers until it moves.

action->Poison Tooth.name: Poison Tooth
action->Poison Tooth.description:
Requirements The krooth damaged a creature with its jaws on its most recent action this turn.

Effect The krooth snaps off one of its teeth in the creature it hit. The creature takes [[/r 1d6[persistent,bleed]]] damage and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Neither can be healed while the tooth remains. Removing the tooth safely requires a successful DC 26 check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid}. Instead of ending bleeding or stabilizing, this removes the drained condition, but it doesn't automatically end the bleed damage.

spell->Glyph of Warding.name: Glyph of Warding
spell->Glyph of Warding.description:
You craft a trap by binding a hostile spell into a symbol. While Casting this Spell, you also Cast a Spell of a lower spell level to store in the glyph. The stored spell must take 3 actions or fewer to cast, have a hostile effect, and target one creature or have an area. You can set a password, a trigger, or both for the glyph. Any creature that moves, opens, or touches the target container or enters the target area that doesn't speak the password or that matches the trigger activates the glyph, releasing the harmful spell within.

Once a spell is stored in the glyph, the glyph gains all the traits of that spell. If the stored spell targets one or more creatures, it targets the creature that set off the glyph. If it has an area, that area is centered on the creature that set off the glyph. Glyph of warding's duration ends when the glyph is triggered. The glyph counts as a magical trap, using your spell DC for both the Perception check to notice it and the Thievery check to disable it; both checks require the creature attempting them to be trained in order to succeed.

You can Dismiss glyph of warding. The maximum number of glyphs of warding you can have active at a time is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

action->Breath of the Bog.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that begins its turn within the area feels as if its lungs were filling with water and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or be unable to speak or breathe. The creature can still hold its breath and can attempt a new save at the end of its turn. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Rise Up.name: Rise Up
action->Rise Up.description:
Trigger A creature walks on top of a bog mummy that lies buried in the mud or peat below

Requirements Initiative has not yet been rolled

Effect The bog mummy automatically notices the creature and Burrows before rolling initiative.

action->Bog Rot.name: Bog Rot
action->Bog Rot.description:
This affliction can't be reduced below stage 1, nor can the damage from it be healed, until it's successfully treated with remove curse or a similar effect; the affliction can then be removed as normal for a disease. A creature killed by bog rot melts into a noxious sludge and can't be resurrected except by a 7th-level resurrect ritual or similar magic

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 minute)

Stage 2 [[/r 3d6[negative]]] damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 day)

action->Draining Presence.name: Draining Presence
action->Draining Presence.description:
10 feet.

A creature entering the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. It recovers after it has been out of the aura for 1 minute. This drained condition value is cumulative with the drained value caused by drain life, but not with multiple draining presence auras.

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to draining presence for 24 hours.

action->Sunlight Powerlessness.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
action->Sunlight Powerlessness.description: A dread wraith caught in sunlight is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

action->Absorb Wraith.name: Absorb Wraith
action->Absorb Wraith.description:
The dread wraith extends its hand toward another wraith creature within 100 feet. The target wraith dissolves and streaks toward the dread wraith in a straight line, dealing [[/r 6d10[negative]]] damage to each creature along the line (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:28|basic:true] save).

The dread wraith absorbs the essence of the target wraith, becoming @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and gaining a +10-foot status bonus to its fly Speed for a number of rounds equal to the level of the absorbed wraith. It can use its extra action only to Fly or Strike.

An unwilling target can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:28|traits:damaging-effect] save to resist being absorbed.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description: When the dread wraith damages a living creature with its spectral hand Strike, the wraith gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the drained condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

action->Wraith Spawn.name: Wraith Spawn
action->Wraith Spawn.description: A living humanoid slain by a wraith's spectral hand Strike rises as a wraith spawn after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This wraith spawn is under the command of the dread wraith that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wraith spawn. If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will and gains drain life and wraith spawn.

action->Otherworldly Vision.name: Otherworldly Vision
action->Otherworldly Vision.description: A froghemoth's alien eyes allow it to perceive creatures within 30 feet, even if they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} or ethereal. It can still be fooled by successful Stealth checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}, but it has Perception DC 38 in such cases. It also sees through and is unaffected by illusions with the visual trait if they are within 30 feet.

action->Electric Torpor.name: Electric Torpor
action->Electric Torpor.description: Though a froghemoth is immune to electricity damage, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round whenever it would have otherwise taken electricity damage.

action->Aquatic Ambush.description:

40 feet

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AquaticAmbush]

action->Barbed Tongue.name: Barbed Tongue
action->Barbed Tongue.description:
A creature hit by the froghemoth's tongue becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the froghemoth. The creature isn't @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the froghemoth's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful Strike against AC 31 that deals at least 15 slashing damage.

This deals no damage to the froghemoth but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 minute.

action->Flailing Tentacles.name: Flailing Tentacles
action->Flailing Tentacles.description: The froghemoth makes up to four tentacle Strikes, each against a different target. These count toward the froghemoth's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

action->Retract Tongue.name: Retract Tongue
action->Retract Tongue.description: The froghemoth pulls a creature grabbed by its tongue toward itself. The froghemoth rolls an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the froghemoth pulls the creature into an adjacent space, and if it critically succeeds it can also make a bite Strike against the creature after the pull.

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

action->Feed.name: Feed
action->Feed.description:
Requirement The ghonhatine is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour

Effect The ghonhatine devours a chunk of the corpse. For 1 minute, the ghonhatine gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing 5} and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. It can gain these benefits from any given corpse only once.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wPW6kVscJgBLPVKZ]{Effect: Ghonhatine Feed}

action->Fleshgout.name: Fleshgout
action->Fleshgout.description:
A ghonhatine's vomit carries an awful disease that, over time, can cause a suffering creature's flesh to develop painful boils that eventually slough away, leaving gaping wounds

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:28]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect ([[/r 1d4 #Incubation]]{1d4 hours})

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

action->Spring Upon Prey.name: Spring Upon Prey
action->Spring Upon Prey.description:
Requirement Initiative has not yet been rolled.

Trigger A creature touches the goliath spider's web while the spider is on it.

Effect The goliath spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.

action->Descend on a Web.name: Descend on a Web
action->Descend on a Web.description:
The goliath spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 5, 20 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

action->Goliath Spider Venom.name: Goliath Spider Venom
action->Goliath Spider Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[poison]]] and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

action->Web Tether.name: Web Tether
action->Web Tether.description:
A creature hit by the spider's web Strike is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider.

The spider can have one creature tethered at a time. The DC to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} the web is 30. The tether can be severed with a Strike (AC 20, Hardness 5, HP 20), but this doesn't free the restrained creature.

action->Sporesight (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Sporesight (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Sporesight (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: The drakauthix exudes a cloud of spores that it uses to see. This is an imprecise sense that functions only in areas without strong wind currents. Sporesight does not function underwater.

action->Obscuring Spores.name: Obscuring Spores
action->Obscuring Spores.description: Whenever the drakauthix takes at least 10 slashing damage, it releases a cloud of brown spores that has the effect of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Obscuring Mist} for 1 minute, centered around the drakauthix. This cloud of spores does not move with the drakauthix, nor is it displaced by its movement.

action->Reel In.name: Reel In
action->Reel In.description: The drakauthix pulls all creatures it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} 15 feet closer to itself.

action->Spore Tendrils.name: Spore Tendrils
action->Spore Tendrils.description: The tendrils that cover the drakauthix's body reach out and infest adjacent creatures, dealing [[/r 4d6[poison]]] damage and [[/r 1d6[persistent,poison]]] damage. A creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save to reduce this damage, but one @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the drakauthix takes a -4 circumstance penalty to this save.

action->Whirlwind of Hooks.name: Whirlwind of Hooks
action->Whirlwind of Hooks.description: The drakauthix whirls, whipping creatures around it. The drakauthix makes a tentacle Strike against every creature within its reach.

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw DC 18 Fortitude

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

weapon->Elven Curve Blade.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.mgrabKkyLmvxgLBK]

Essentially a longer version of the scimitar, this traditional elven weapon has a thinner blade than its cousin.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XyA6PKV46aNlLXOd]

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

armor->Chain Mail.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Kf4eJEXnFPuAsseP]

A suit of chain mail consists of several pieces of armor composed of small metal rings linked together in a protective mesh. It typically includes a chain shirt, leggings, a pair of arms, and a coif, collectively protecting most of the body.

consumable->Bolts.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AITVZmakiu3RgfKo]

Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.
